appearances.title: MS NOW Reports : MSNOW : January 1, 2026 8:00am-9:01am PST
appearances.snippet: i was just listening to senator james lankford talk about this. republican senators want to see a cap on who's going to receive these benefits. they want to see a full overhaul before they would agree to extending them. so where does that where does that leave proposals that actually could get some support? you know, are there going to be republican proposals? we're going to see that they can all rally around. >> yeah. well, there are bipartisan proposals right now in conversations that have happened with susan collins. she's kind of leading the charge over in the senate and bernie moreno as well. so i think it's possible that something sort of comes together. it's going to have to be led in the senate. and then, you know, it will be a matter of of if the house takes it up and if they can move something forward. the house is on a very different track. of course, they they want to do another reconciliation package on health care, which is sort of a whole other can of worms. yeah. but, you know, they are focused more on getting money directly to the

appearances.title: Katy Tur Reports : MSNOW : January 14, 2026 11:00am-1:00pm PST
appearances.snippet: mitch mcconnell, susan collins, james lankford, jerry moran, you know, there's a lot of folks who dot greenland, and they're worried it's going to harm our alliances and make russia feel emboldened. so it's not just an isolated one, senator, who's paying attention to this. i think everybody's treating it a lot more seriously than they did just a few weeks ago. >> burgess, here's a curveball for you. murkowski in the past had said that she would. i don't know if open is the right word, but she had been asked about whether she wanted to declare independence and caucus with the democrats. it seems like she's been on the opposing end of a lot of trump policies. and trump moves lately, especially. is that the sort of thing that comes up with her at all? >> you know, every two years as we get close to the midterms, i think it's a question that's asked of her. i know she's had that conversation before. she even told me in the past that she has had that conversation before with democrats. but would she switch caucuses? i think that it's not super likely, but i also think if she thought it wa

appearances.title: Alex Witt Reports : MSNOW : January 10, 2026 10:00am-1:00pm PST
appearances.snippet: so senators from both sides of the aisle that includes democrat elissa slotkin and republican james lankfordeak it, you buy it. well, it seems the u.s. has bought it. so what will efforts in venezuela look like in the long run? >> well, i think there are many things that need to happen. i've seen some things, frankly, that look positive to me. delcy rodriguez, the acting president, has moderated the way she's speaking. diosdado cabello, the interior minister who's responsible for the kind of motorcycle gang that they use to terrorize political opposition. he's been more subdued and pulled them back. they released 8 or 9 political prisoners. now they have 900. so all of those types of things have to the initial pieces of this are quite positive things, moving in a good direction, but not quickly enough. if you look at other historical examples, and probably the closest one will be would be panama. restoring democracy was a first order imperative that happened immediately. in the case of panama, it appears to me that democracy is an eventuality. we'll get to it eventually. after doing all of t
